With the onset of sea breeze there is a ... in temperature and ... in RH.
A sea breeze typically sets in during the day and dies off at what time?
options: A. At night and dies off during the day
B. Sets in during the day and dies off at night
C. Occurs both during the day and night

questions.question_text: Which conditions lead to mountain waves?
options: A. Unstable moist air, speeds <5 kt across the ridge
B. Stable air, speed, >20 kt across the ridge
C. Unstable air, speed >20 kt across the ridge
D. Stable air, speed >30 kt, parallel to the ridge

questions.question_text: What cloud types are classified as medium cloud?
What is a cold pool?
options: A. Found south of the Alps if there is NW airflow
B. Cool area of weather which disappears at night
C. Cold pool is most evident behind polar frontal weather in mid temperate areas with little or no sign on significant weather charts
D. Air trapped on the leeward side of mountain ranges

questions.question_text: Which layer of the atmosphere contains more than 90% of all water vapour?
When do cold occlusions occur most frequently in Europe?
Dust storms and haze are most common:
options: A. in association with the sub tropical anticyclones over land
B. with the Haboobs in winter
C. in unstable air with low pressure

The airmass which originates over equatorial region is

A WD originate over
options: C. Mediterranean, Caspian and Black sea

options: A. Contours far apart, weak wind
B. Contours far apart, strong wind

questions.question_text: Generally northern hemisphere winds at 5000 FT/AGL are southwesterly while most of the surface winds are southerly. What is the primary reason of difference between these two wind directions?
options: A. A strong pressure gradient at higher altitudes.
B. Friction between the wind and the surface.
C. Stronger Coriolis force at the surface.
D. The influence of warm air at the lower altitude.

questions.question_text: In a land- and sea-breeze circulation the land-breeze blows:
options: A. during the day and is stronger than the sea-breeze.
B. during the night and is weaker than the sea-breeze.
C. during the day and is weaker than the sea-breeze.
D. during the night and is stronger than the sea-breeze.

questions.question_text: Relative humidity
options: A. is higher in warm air than in cool air
B. increases if the air is cooled whilst maintaining the vapour pressure constant
C. is higher in cool air than in warm air
D. decreases if the air is cooled whilst maintaining the vapour pressure constant

questions.question_text: Dew point is defined as
options: A. the lowest temperature at which evaporation will occur for a given pressure
B. the lowest temperature to which air must be cooled in order to reduce the relative humidity
C. the temperature to which moist air must be cooled to become saturated at a given pressure
D. the temperature below which the change of state in a given volume of air will result in the absorption of latent heat

questions.question_text: Relative humidity depends on
options: A. moisture content and pressure of the air
B. moisture content of the air only
C. temperature of the air only
D. moisture content and temperature of the air

questions.question_text: Relative humidity at a given temperature is the relation between
options: A. water vapour weight and dry air weight
B. water vapour weight and humid air volume
C. actual water vapour content and saturated water vapour content
D. dew point and air temperature

questions.question_text: Large hail stones
options: A. only occur in thunderstorms of mid-latitudes
B. are entirely composed of clear ice
C. are typically associated with severe thunderstorms
D. only occur in frontal thunderstorms

questions.question_text: An airmass is unstable when
options: A. temperature and humidity are not constant
B. an ascending parcel of air continues to rise to a considerable height.
C. pressure shows a marked variation over a given horizontal area

questions.question_text: Which is true of a typical non frontal thermal depression?
options: A. It forms over land in summer
B. It forms over the ocean in winter
C. It forms over land in summer
D. It forms over land in winter

questions.question_text: A cold pool
options: A. develops usually in winter when very unstable maritime polar or maritime arctic air currents stream southwards along the eastern side of an extensive ridge of high pressure, in association with occluded systems
B. is usually most evident in the circulation and temperature fields of the middle troposphere and may show little or no sign on a surface chart
C. normally disappears at night and occurs almost exclusively in summer
D. occurs frequently in winter to the south of the Alps when this region is under the influence of cold north-westerly airstream

questions.question_text: During which stage of thunderstorm development are rotor winds characterized by roll clouds most likely to occur?
options: D. Cumulus stage and mature stage.

questions.question_text: If CAVOK is reported then
options: B. low level windshear has not been reported
C. any CB's have a base above 5000 FT
D. no low drifting snow is present

questions.question_text: The dew point temperature
options: A. is higher if air contains more water vapour
B. changes by cooling or warming
C. is equal to the air temperature during mist
D. is always higher than wet bulb temperature for unsaturated air

questions.question_text: The hailstones occur from
options: A. both warm and cold clouds

questions.question_text: Hazardous vortex turbulence that might be encountered behind large aircraft is created only when that aircraft is:
How does the wake turbulence vortex circulate around each wingtip, when viewed from the rear:
options: A. Inward, upward, and around the wingtip.
C. Outward, upward, and around the wingtip.
D. Outward, downward and around the wingtip.

questions.question_text: In the system of high and low pressure of surface charts, which of the sentences are correct?
options: B. Surface winds, strong and parallel to isobars
C. Surface winds, strong and below across isobar
